name: Defender: 10-Liner Basic Game Jam 2021
description:
"Defender" is written in Micro Color Basic on my favourite 8-bit computer, and the first computer I ever owned, the TRS-80 Micro Color Computer or MC-10.  Some call it the "Poco" because it is the little brother to the Tandy Color Computer.  It's a budget 8-bit micro along the lines of the Sinclair ZX-81.

The game can be played at my website using Mike Tinnes' TRS-80 MC-10 Emulator. Just select DEFENDER from the cassette menu, and then type RUN in the main screen and hit . Type LIST to see the instructions below from the end of the program.

12 REM DEFENDER BY JIM GERRIE

13 REM ASCII BASIC GAME

14 REM 10-LINER CONTEST 2021

15 REM USE A W S AND Z TO

16 REM MOVE WHITE TARGETTING

17 REM CURSOR & PAINT MISSILE

18 REM TO STOP IT. CITY CAN

19 REM ONLY TAKE 10 HITS

20 REM PRESS MUTIPLE KEYS 

21 REM AT THE SAME TIME TO 

22 REM MOVE DIAGONALLY

#asciibasic10liner
